text:
Patient is an 83 yr old female with PMHX of CHF
EF of 40%with 3+MRwho
   was admitted on [**12-1**]  from OSH where she was being evaluated for
   weakness  and was diagnosed with AF/RVR treated with diltiazem and
   Lasix drip.  She triggered on [**Hospital Ward Name 408**] 3 for hypotension and worsening CHF.
   [**12-7**] swan inserted with wedge 30-> Taken to the cath lab for IAB
   support. TTE  revealed a torn chordae at the tip of the posterior
   leaflet with partial flail.
   Heart failure (CHF), Systolic, Acute on Chronic
   Assessment:
   Con
t on 1:1 IABP support- generalized 3- 4+ edema- low U/O- labile B/P
   MAPs 50
s- Hct 28 this am.
   Action:
    Neo gtt increased to 3mcq/kg/min-  levophed gtt started & presently @
   .216mcq/kg/min - total 2L fluid boluses  and 2u PRBC
s given.
   Response:
   Uremic- BUN/Crea trending up 40/2.0- renal consulted- family refused
   CRRT @ this time- family meeting arranged this afternoon- patient made
   DNR- hypotension con
t  despite pressors, blood and IVF- 1L NS fluid
   bolus again ordered and given- Hct post transfusions 36.1
   Plan:
   Titrate pressors to maintain MAPs 60- follow ABG
s and U/O-
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   T max 100.8 Core- WBC 35.3- hypotensive requiring fluid boluses and
   pressors.l
   Action:
   Vanco, zosyn and flagyl given as ordered- nasal swab r/o influenza
   done- swab for C diff done- ID consulted- zosyn and flagyl D/C
   meropenem ordered- 1000mg IV given @ 1630-> 500mg IV q12hrs ordered.
   Response:
   CO/CI 6.0/3.3 SVR 788- afebrile this afternoon- MAPs 60
s @ present w/
   neo & levo gtts and fluid boluses.
   Plan:
   Con
t present management- follow temp curve- ? surveillance cultures
   tomorrow.
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   Tele: SR to junctional this am- approx 0745 went into RAF.
   Action:
   Amiodarone gtt @ .5mg/min maintained- heparin gtt restarted @ 12n @
   1500u/hr.
   Response:
   HR trending down- unable to wean pressors.
   Plan:
   Con
t heparin gtt
 repeat PTT due @ 1800.
